metadata.title: CVE-2021-33909 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
fs/seq_file.c in the Linux kernel 3.16 through 5.13.x before 5.13.4 doesnot properly restrict seq buffer allocations, leading to an integeroverflow, an Out-of-bounds Write, and escalation to root by an unprivilegeduser, aka CID-8cae8cd89f05.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33909` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-212-generic - 4.4.0-212.244
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-212-generic - 4.4.0-212.244
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-212-lowlatency - 4.4.0-212.244
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-lowlatency - 4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1095-kvm - 4.4.0-1095.104
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1130-aws - 4.4.0-1130.144
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1109-aws - 4.15.0-1109.116~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1121-azure - 4.15.0-1121.134~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1106-gcp - 4.15.0-1106.120~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1078-oracle - 4.15.0-1078.86~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-212.244').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1095.104').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1130.144').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1109.116~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1121.134~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1106.120~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1078.86~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
